title: The beautiful tricks of flowers
description: In this visually dazzling talk, Jonathan Drori shows the extraordinary ways flowering plants -- over a quarter million species -- have evolved to attract insects to spread their pollen: growing 'landing-strips' to guide the insects in, shining in ultraviolet, building elaborate traps, and even mimicking other insects in heat.
author: Jonathan Drori
keywords: TED, talks, bees, biology, botany, environment, insects, life, science, sex, plants
